isis.stitle: TSI 05-12-36 - Inspection and Correction Procedures for International® Engines Subjected to Flood Water

subjectgroup.subject: Inspection and Correction Procedures for International® Engines Subjected to Flood Water

geninfo.para: Procedures in this TSI are intended to reduce the risk of major engine failure for engines having been partially or totally submerged during a flood. Doing these procedures does not completely eliminate possible engine failure.

note.para: These procedures do not carry expressed or implied warranty by International Truck and Engine Corporation. Engine damage or failure, caused by flood water, is not a defect in material or workmanship on the part of International; therefore, damage or failure will not be covered by International.

caution.para: Do not start the engine until the following engine systems have been inspected and corrected:
Remove main negative battery cable before doing the following procedures.

step1.para: Loosen drain plug in oil pan and drain 1 quart of engine oil into a suitable container.
Check for water in the oil.

item.para: If water is in the oil, change engine oil, tighten drain plug, install new filters, and continue with Fuel Supply System.
If water is not in the oil, tighten drain plug, add oil to the correct level, and continue with Fuel Supply System.

step1.para: Loosen drain plug in fuel tanks and drain 1 quart of fuel into a suitable container.
Check for water in the fuel.

item.para: If water is in the fuel, continue with step 3.
If water is not in the fuel, tighten drain plug, and continue with Air Management System.

step1.para: Drain fuel from tanks, fuel lines, and fuel filter.
Clean fuel tanks, fuel lines, and fuel filter.
Tighten drain plug.
Continue with Air Management System.
Remove air filter elements.
Check for water in the air filter housing. Clean if necessary.
Install new air filter elements.
Remove air intake piping and check for rust or corrosion. Clean if necessary.
Check compressor side of turbocharger for debris, rust or corrosion.

item.para: If debris, rust or corrosion is found, rebuild the turbocharger (V8 only). Install a new turbocharger for (V6 and I6 only).
If necessary, flush water from inlet and outlet tubing of turbocharger to prevent corrosion.

step1.para: Remove, clean, and re-install the Charge Air Cooler (CAC).
Remove, clean, and re-install EGR valve.
Remove exhaust piping between the turbocharger and muffler/converter.
Check for water in the muffler/converter.

item.para: If water was or is in the muffler/converter, continue with step 10.
If water was not in the turbocharger or muffler/converter, continue with Power Cylinders.

step1.para: Drain water from muffler/converter piping.
Check turbine side of turbocharger for debris, rust or corrosion.

item.para: If debris, rust or corrosion is found, rebuild the turbocharger (V8 only). Install a new turbocharger for (V6 and I6 only).

step1.para: Remove, clean, and re-install the EGR cooler.
Continue with Power Cylinders.
Try to turn the crankshaft two full revolutions by hand, using hand tools; do not crank with starter motor.

item.para: If excessive effort is obvious, continue with steps 2-11

step1.para: Remove fuel injectors.
Remove glow plugs (V6 and V8).
Disconnect air inlet hose and discharge line from air compressor (if equipped).
Rotate crankshaft with hand tools to purge liquid from cylinders.
Install main negative battery cable.
Crank engine to completely purge liquid from cylinders.
Remove main negative battery cable.
Squirt 1 oz of clean engine oil into cylinders and turn crankshaft two revolutions.
Install injectors.
Install glow plugs (V6 and V8).
Continue with Engine Cleaning
Clean or install new starter motor and alternator. See Manufacturer's instructions.
Steam clean engine to remove salt.
Continue with Engine Start and Operation
Connect main negative battery cable.
Start engine and listen for unusual noises.

note.para: White smoke may result from oil sprayed in power cylinders; smoke should clear within 10 minutes.

item.para: If engine will not start, see Engine Operation and Maintenance Manual.
If engine will still not start, see Engine Diagnostic Manual

step1.para: Use the Electronic Service Tool (EST) and check for Diagnostic Trouble Codes (DTCs). Correct problems.
Operate engine under load as soon as possible and burn off residual moisture.
